name: International Economics
descriptions: The International Economics minor focuses on global economic systems, trade, and development. Students take 18 hours including at least one intermediate course and a concentration in international economics topics.
A minimum of 12 hours must be at the advanced level (30000 or above). At least 9 hours must be in international economics courses. This minor is not available to economics majors.

courses: One of: ECON 30223 - Intermediate Microeconomics, ECON 31223 - Intermediate Microeconomics: A Mathematical Approach, or ECON 30233 - Intermediate Macroeconomics - 3 hrs.

electiveCourses.description: 15 additional hours, with at least 9 hours in international economics courses and a minimum of 12 total hours at the 30000 level or above. Not available to economics majors.
